Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: panzergirl
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the other positive reviews. My two toddlers, husband and I stayed here the 3-day Labor Day weekend 2012 for less than $450. Was this a luxurious stay? No (the furniture/decor was very dated), but we were provided everything that we needed - clean towels, fridge, microwave, sink, dish soap and dishrag/towels, dishes, and a small coffee maker. The staff was extremely kind and welcoming, and the rooms were large and clean. We stayed in room 205 and the beds were comfy! (My sister stayed in 204, and the beds were creaky and OK at best). The pool was clean and never crowded, even on a holiday weekend. The Beachcomber was conveniently located to a number of restaurants within walking distance, as well as putt putt, and of course it was only a block from the beach, with no streets to cross. For the price, I doubt you could beat this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KayB2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of August 17th. We found the motel to be very clean and the staff was very friendly. We stayed on the 5th floor and had a view of the bay and a small view of the ocean. The bathroom was a small but manageable. The room itself large and comfortable. If you are looking for a clean room at a great value then this is the motel for you. We will return to this motel on our next trip to Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: silverwoodchuck47
Reviews.Content: This is based on a visit during August 2012. Pros: *The place is "hotel clean." *Rates are reasonable based on location and time of year. *There is parking is under the structure--this means the sun is not beating on your car all day. *Walking distance to the beach. *Hotel pool is small, but clean and well-maintained. *Ironing board, iron, frig, microwave, kitchenette available in our room. *Staff is friendly and helpful. *Garden hose near the entrance is available to wash beach sand off yourself. *Elevator is large and responsive. Cons: *Rooms face the main road (Coastal Hwy) instead of the ocean, which is partially obscured by other buildings closer to the ocean. *Traffic is loud unless the door to the balcony is closed. *No Internet access. ("Go to McDonald's") *Room key is an old school metal key with a plastic tag with the room number imprinted on it. *No room safe. *A/C filter cleaning/replacement is needed. A/C unit it loud. Wear noise plugs to bed. *If you're looking for privacy while you change in your room, the bathroom is the only place to do it, and it's really small. So if you're a big person... Other observations: *There are two handicap parking spaces. *Hotel pool's deep end is 5 feet. There is no diving board (which is a good thing in this case). *The exterior and the room interiors appear to have been recently painted--and painted properly. *There is at least one cart available to make the moving of luggage from your car to your room easier. *There is no fitness center. *There is no free breakfast or other similar amenities. *The ice machine is the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: ruthy918
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see so many good reviews on a motel that was so reasonably priced so I decided to try it out. I have to say It was VERY clean and rooms Very big....the view to the bay was refreshing the beach was only a half a block a way and we were far enough from the hustle an bustle to actually enjoy our vacation me and my boyfriend stayed for 2 nights and never heard any excessive noise and slept so comfortable. The staff was also very accommodating I lost a piece of my earring down the sink and the staff tried for 40 min to get it out! Although they couldn't I appreciated the effort. I will definitely be coming back to stay here on my next visit and would recommend this place to anyone who wants a clean place with a good location and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best priced motel in OC Maryland!”
Reviews.Author: Georgia P
Reviews.Content: Just spent four days at the Beachcomber and it was great. Been going to OC for over 30 years and have been in many motels, low to high rates. Must say we were pleasantly surprised with the Beachcomber beings the rates were so low. The rooms were very spacious, very clean and beds were so comfy. Had a small kitchenette, a/c worked great and never ran out of hot water like most hotels. The pool was very clean and refreshing and only 1/2 block walk to the beach. The owners and cleaning staff were very nice and pleasant to deal with. I have been in very expensive hotels ranging 200-300 and this was by far a much cleaner and roomier hotel than those that were so expensive. I will continue to stay at the Beachcomber every visit to OC. No more hotel/motel searching for me. I've found the best in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: littlemiss77
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I am from NJ and familiar with the Jersey shore motel rooms that cost $200 a night and you usually share with the roaches! When I saw the price of this motel per night ($130-$150) I thought that it would be something comparable to what I get in the Jersey shore. I wasn't looking for anything fancy. This motel exceeded my expectations!! We arrived early in the morning, not expecting to check in until 3pm, the directed time. I went to the front desk upon my arrival which was 9am. The front desk staff is extremely friendly! They offered me a parking pass, completed my paperwork in a timely manner and explained that the room was not ready yet but they would call me as soon as it was available. We headed down to the beach which was within walking distance and relaxed on the beach for awhile. Front desk called around 1130am and said the room was ready. I was impressed with the service! The rooms were decent. Very spacious. We had a king size bed and a double bed, even though I only asked for a king. There was a private balcony and a very small area with a stove, sink and microwave. The room also has a large dresser and closet and a small dining table. The negatives, the beds were hard and uncomfortable. The bathroom could use some updating, I had to hold up the drain in the sink to let the water go down. The location was great. Right across the street from big peckers and bayside skillet (amazing crepes). Walking distance to Bj's on the bay. Within a few blocks of Seacrets. That was our main reason for our trip to OC and I was a little bummed that it was not as close as they had made it sound. Princess bayside is the hotel to stay in if you want to be within walking distance of Seacrets. If you are down for some sun, sand and drinks, great food and floating in the ocean this is a great place!! We had a blast and can't wait to return! Overall I recommend this motel. It's your basic beach motel with a great value and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: theschumbers
Reviews.Content: I was very leary considering the price. Most places in this price range in OC are dumps, but this was clean, the pool was great, good beach access and no problems with the staff. Would stay again. As I was once told some people like it some people don't :-)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “The Johnson's from NJ 2012”
Reviews.Author: Isabel M
Reviews.Content: These brothers go out of there way to make you feel welcome. we got there pretty early so we were worry we couldn't get our room until "check in time" but they had no problem with it so we were very happy! We spent 3 days there - the rooms were nice and clean the pool was clean couldn't get my daughter out of there! the beach is very close by. The location was good for us didn't want to be near the broadwalk or all that noise! We will Defiantly go back next year again, although the hubby is talking about going back again in August :)

Reviews.Title: “It's our 3rd year at the Beachcomber and we love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: RotaHoota
Reviews.Content: When my friend from Florida comes to visit Maryland, we always make plans to vacation in Ocean City, MD. This is our 3rd year staying at the Beachcomber. The motel is not only affordable and convenient to the beach, it is also clean, spacious, and comfortable. It is also in easy walking distance to a few other establishments of interest, if you just don't want the headache of driving in the traffic on Coastal Highway for the day. The owners, Tom and John Berry, are very courteous when making reservations and at check-in. Their friend, Dave, is also very helpful, when he fills in for them. They always ask if there's anything we need and if we're having a nice time. They don't hesitate in giving us advice on where to dine and shop, if asked. We know the rules of the motel and abide by them. The pool is for the guests of the Beachcomber; not for everyone elses' guests. The pool is clean and spotless for their paying customers; not for your friends staying at other hotels and motels. If you have a complaint as to why your friends can't use the pool, use theirs instead! While we were there, two young girls walked right from the beach to use the pool. John asked them if they were staying at the Beachcomber, (he suspected that they weren't.) They acted dumb and said, "Huh?" John asked them what room they were staying in, and the one girl looked at the other and said, "He wants to know what room we're staying in," as if the other girl didn't understand English. The friend said nothing, then they turned and walked away. That's beacause they weren't staying at the Beachcomber and tried to lie their way to the pool. They just wanted to cleanse themselves of sand in the Beachcomber pool and leave. Now how ignorant is that?? It makes you wonder what kind of parents they have? Although the bathrooms are a bit small, they serve their purpose and are always very clean!! They have new shower curtains which are nice because they let in more light when showering. They used to have towel bars in the bathrooms, but because some parents don't know how to teach their children to respect other people's property, the towel bars were pulled out of the walls by those unruly children!! Even though the Beachcomber faces Coastal Highway, there is an ocean VIEW from the upper floors off the elevator. AND YES, THEY HAVE AN ELEVATOR, WHICH IS GREAT!!!! The cleaning staff is very friendly and accommodating, as well. Whatever you need, they will supply it for you every morning on their cleaning rounds. There is enough parking spots for registered guests, only!! So if you lie to the Berry's when making your reservations and they evict you for not abiding by their rules, then that's no one's fault but your own. And trust me, no one will miss you or care if you go and lie to others, somewhere else! The Berry's are doing their job and trying to make their motel comfortable for their REGISTERED guests. If that's not good enough for you trouble-makers, liars, and complainers, take a hike!!!!!!! We will continue to stay at the Beachcomber each year. We love the place!! Robin and Nancy

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: alk79
Reviews.Content: We just came home from Ocean City MD and we didnt make any plans to stay anywhere... My husband stopped at another location to which it was a condo... The lady inside gave us this number to this hotel and said her friend owned it so we called First they were VERY nice and held the room just to see if we liked it! We did and we stayed there for 2days! Second the guy at the front desk seen us a number of times and didnt even forget who we were it was like you were family or been there hundreds of times, he would talk to us and our child... Third they always asked if we were enjoying our stay and if there was anything they could help with! This may have been our 1st trip to OC but its the 1st of many and WE WILL STAY HERE!...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money. This place is not a dump.”
Reviews.Author: Julie21037
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected change of plans and although VERY familiar with Ocean City, our usual place fell through. So, at midnight on 7/29, we were left wandering up and down coastal highway looking for accommodations. Several of the places we stopped were in the $200 range. We negotiated a rate of $145 + taxes per night for a queen/king kitchenette combo. The room was clean, though sparse. It's not the most recent decorating theme - but servicable since we had 5 people in the room (2 adults, 3 kids) and needed beds to accommodate us all. The bathroom wasn't the absolute cleanest - but this was acceptable and as I said, it is not a dump... There's a balcony that overlooks coastal highway - this place sits on 75th street ocean block/the corner so it's a decent walk to the beach. There is adequate parking (1 space per room), an elevator, and exterior walk-up entrances that afford privacy since the windows all face in the opposite direction. Although we didn't have our pet with us, I think I read somewhere that pets were allowed, too. I would definitely stay here again, if I needed a room. The check in/check out was efficient and pleasant. Couldn't really ask for more considering we were desperate and on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “I do not see why this place got such good reviews”
Reviews.Author: kt266
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked a room at the Beachcomber for the two of us in late July 2011. The price was right and the room was also acceptable and spacious. We are two senior women. We were treated nicely during check in. But gentleman who checked us in told us he was not actually a member of the staff. He was just helping out. On day two we invited my daughter (whose family was staying at a condo one block away)and her three children to come to the pool for a swim. We were the only people at the pool and it was very nice (but small). My sister go out of the pool and was approached through the fence by a man in sunglasses. He asked her "what room are you staying in." She asked him who he was and why he was asking for her room number (considering the security issues). He said he was the owner and pointed to the Beachcomber logo on his shirt. He then asked her how many people were staying in our room. She responded "two." He said to her "you have two people registered, but you take 8, 9 10 people to the pool". (We had 4 additional people with us). Then he began going through a recital of how people register and bring back more people to stay in the room and steal things from the rooms. This simply was not what we had done--my daughter had her own place to stay. I came up to the fence and asked what was wrong. He then said the same thing to me about additional people staying in the rooms and stealing things. I responded if my daughter and grandchildren were not allowed in the pool, we would leave. He said that was not the point and went on again about how people bring more people than are registered and steal from the rooms (he would stop bringing this up, even though we were the only people staying in the room). This was completely insulting, as we are honest people and there was nothing of value in the room to steal (no shampoo, lotion, or coffee (usually provided by most motels). We got our things together and left the pool (we were there less than 45 minutes). This situation made us very uncomfortable the remainder of our stay. I felt they were watching us closely and we felt threatened by that man and others in the office (all men). We kept the deadbolt on during the night, but took all valuables with us when we went out of the room. I would never recommend the Beachcomber to anyone, ever. The staff does not know how to treat their paying customers by accusing them of things they are not guilty of. As I said, I am a senior citizen and have never been treated with such lack of respect or suspicision at any hotel/motel in my life. The person who confronted us at the pool area had no people skills and handled this situation poorly. As I said before, I felt uneasy, unsafe and uncomfortable the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “They saved our weekend”
Reviews.Author: fsavill
Reviews.Content: The people at the Beachcomber were SO helpful to us last weekend. The room was very spacious, and all of the accommodations were both clean and comfortable. The staff were approachable and helped us with several issues. I had taken a tumble the night before, and they gave me full access to a medical cabinet with all kinds of stuff - saving me a trip to the pharmacy. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Signature100
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean motel. Attentive and friendly staff. The pool was the cleanest I've ever seen at the beach. Good location, oceanblock. Only a short 1/2 block walk to the beach, no streets to cross, which was wonderful as we were traveling with two small children. Elevator. Affordable rates. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: lebukoski
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to take a last minute trip down to O.C. for the weekend and didn't want to spend more than 200 per night. I saw great reviews for this place on here, and when I checked the rates they were only 130 so I chanced it and booked the hotel. It was the best 260 we ever spent. The room wasn't anything glamorous but it was definitely clean which to us was all that mattered. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We were right across the street from a bus stop, which made it easy to get places, and just a very short walk to the beach. I highly recommend this place to anyone who just needs a clean place to crash. Its great value for the money you spend. We will most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, awful rooms, waste of money”
Reviews.Author: gohabsgo9
Reviews.Content: The staff was particularly rude and would never give their names. The room was not what we asked for. It was dirty, the lock on the door never worked and we got charged for it despite complaints. When I was holding the elevator the manager yelled at us to not do that.

Reviews.Title: “Worst OC Hotel experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: epyx337
Reviews.Content: Okay, so where to begin....I had originally reserved a two night stay at the Beach Comber Motel for the Friday and Saturday of the 2010 Memorial Day weekend for two people. After check in I left the hotel and returned later that night around 10pm with the person I checked in with as well as 2 others who were not staying. At this point I and my guests were accosted by hotel staff and told that were being evicted, at this point I was a little confused as to what I had done wrong so I went to the front desk to try and reason with them. After trying to have a civil conversation with the man at the front desk I was informed that the reason for my eviction was that I was not allowed to bring anyone back to the hotel room who I did not register (unheard of for a hotel in Ocean City) I tried to explain that they were not staying and even offered to pay the extra 10$ per person but they would not hear it. They offered to refund my money for the the second night but not the first which was simply unacceptable. The entire time the hotel staff were aggressive and confrontational, I stepped outside to walk to my car and one member of the staff followed me and made physical threats against me and threatened to smash the windows on my car. The entire time I somehow manged to keep my cool, at this point I left and found better accommodation for the weekend. MY advice? It was a nice hotel but the actions of the staff were completely deplorable, save your time and more importantly your money and look else where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value”
Reviews.Author: yannismom
Reviews.Content: When I first discovered this motel I was a little leary of the price. But after reading the reviews I decided to book this place for myself, my mother, and my daughter. However a few days prior to our departure date I saw two very unkind reviews of this place. One about it being a smelly unclean place and another about the owner being racists. Well I became extremely nervous but when we arrived all fears were laid to rest. The owner greated us with a warm friendly welcome and when we got into our room it was clean and there was no foul ordors. We enjoyed our entire stay and would defintely return for another stay. For the location which is less than a half block to the beach and the price $118 per night you can't beat this motel. While it's not the Hilton it's also not a dump in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tmlweller09
Reviews.Content: Planned a last minute trip to Ocean City for the fourth of July weekend and found a cool place called Beachcomber. It was inexpensive, great location and very accommodating staff. John the person who took my reservation even supplied me with a weather report before we even got there. Cleanliness, location, price and staff were excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: trvellingtwo
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Beachcomber July 5 - 10 and have absolutely NO complaints. The room totally met our needs - microwave, refrig, iron, board, comfy beds, beautiful view of the bay, and spacious. The pool was very clean. All the grounds were kept spotless. The staff was very accomodating and exceptionally nice. No complaints from us. We'll definately stay there again. Highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ashntorsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed Mon June 29 and left Fri July 3. There were 2 adults, a 6 yr and 14 yr old. The rooms are just as they look on their website. There are 2 beds (1 king, 1 full), table with chairs, mini fridge, sink, 2 burner stove top, vanity area, bathroom with tub/shower and a private balcony overlooking the street (there are no ocean views). The room was clean and had no weird smells. The pool was clean. The staff was friendly. Only drawback is there are no laundry facilities (theres a small laundromat on 64th st). The location is pretty far from the boardwalk (appx 52 blocks) but it's got a great beach location. It's on the same side as the beach so theres no need to cross the busy roads. If were go to OC MD again, we would stay here again. Overall for OC MD, the food prices I thought were kinda high. We went to the Trimpers park (my kids loved it, $20 wristband for 6 hrs), and old pro golf which they loved too. We also went to the Jolly Roger park, but were really disappointed with it ($16.99 for 4 hrs and the staff is rude, rides not clean).

Reviews.Title: “"Then you don't want to stay at my motel"”
Reviews.Author: def321
Reviews.Content: I was trying to book a reservation at this motel after reading the reviews and thought this would be a good place to stay. I asked the price and got what sounded like a great deal. I saw the picture of the motel on their website and asked the gentleman if the hotel had any amenities. He said that they didn't but there were a lot of places nearby. I then asked if the doors opened to the outside or an inside hallway. He siad the outside. I couldn't tell by the photo if there were stairs or an elevator so I asked him if there was an elevator in the lobby for the higher floors. He asked me why I wanted to know. Taken aback by this I sad because I am potential customer and I just wanted to know. He said "Well as a potential owner, I want to know why you want to know". So I said "because of security". Then he said "Well you don't want my motel" and hung up on me. I have booked hotels all over the east coast and in Europe, and this was the rudest phone conversation I have ever had for booking a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great price”
Reviews.Author: crazykatesmom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to the Beachcomber last August. paid $99 a night, stayed from Monday to Friday. was a little leery of how cheap it was, but was pleasantly surprised. Was not the Ritz, but was clean, comfortable, convenient to beach, and quiet. Our TV stopped working our 2nd day there, within 10 minutes of calling office, another TV was installed. will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: Greekgunner
Reviews.Content: The owner greeted us with a hello when we went into the office and remembered when I called over a month ago because how busy he was that day I called. He gave us the insights about the place and around Ocean City as to where to park and places that are good to eat. The staff was accomodating and friendly and we were always greeted with a hello. The pool was very clean as was the room. For the price that one pays, it is affordable for those on a budget. Real close to the beach and all questions were answered.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Nothing”
Reviews.Author: Terpatt
Reviews.Content: I agree with a lot of the other comments as far as the good and not so good. My husband and I came to O.C. to watch a band at Fager's Island. This motel was the cheapest and closest to Fager's. It was $168 plus taxes, all the other hotels/motels were either not vacant or cost $200 plus and we checked out about 6. The motel met our basic needs and is typical for a busy place like O.C. We did have the misfortune of getting a unit that had a wet ceiling in the bathroom because someone in the unit above it had taken a shower while leaving the curtain outside of the tub. If you are a light sleeper, I DO NOT recommend this place. The traffic noise was horrible and we used a sound machine. The trash truck came at 6:30 a.m. on Sunday and made one heck of a racket out back. The beds are a little hard. The quick walk to the beach and some restaurants (BJ's) was convenient. The little kitchen was nice; however, I had to buy some coffee and fortunately brought shampoo because neither were provided. I was surprised at not having any shampoo. I left some coffee for the next folks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great rates!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovefurrycritters
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this GREAT hotel! EVERYTHING was very very good! The rooms are VERY clean; the AC works VERY well, the shower is GREAT; the owners are GREAT; the beds are VERY comfortable! I would definitely go back to this hotel AGAIN & AGAIN! I'm not sure WHY the last person reviewed this hotel so badly???? I absolutely do NOT agree with his/her comments! HIGHLY recommended!

Reviews.Title: “definitely not what these people claimed it would be....”
Reviews.Author: oceangoddessmd
Reviews.Content: I am happy that the other people who wrote reviews obviously have never stayed in a real decent motel before because this place is a dump and the price isn't that cheap I found four other places in OC that were bigger, newer and nicer for much less money. The customer service is horrible, the only decent part was the pool it was actually cleaner then our room. The beds were very hard had to go and buy an air bed so we could sleep so all in all could have stayed at one of the better places for what I spent in all for comfort. Think twice before you believe the rest of these.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Prozy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this hotel Friday 25th 2008.. This Hotel is underrated for it's value & services.. a simple but very catering needs of it's guests. Who needs Gyms & indoor pools when your at the Beach! Many block's to walk to see things or go shopping if you want to excercise.. Short distance to the beach area & being at 75th street the best of being up-town if you want to go or downtown to the inlet & go to the boardwalk. This is an unexposed jewel for the simple beach stay without all the glitz & expense others charge.. Great Place would definately stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, not to near the Boardwalk but near enough!”
Reviews.Author: Travelmez
Reviews.Content: Needed a cheap and cheerful place to stay for 2 families of 5. This place has basic but clean rooms with fridge, microwave and 2 ring stove top. We were able to get adjoining rooms which meant the teenagers (and us) had some separate space! The beach is literally 2 mins down the side street, no roads to cross, and is wide and sandy. The pool was clean and in the sun most of the day. Staff were pleasant and helpful, even supplying the ever needed corkscrew!! Various Restaurants right down and across the road. One with the biggest all you can eat buffet I have ever seen! Only down side was that the balconies faced the road but once the day time traffic calmed down it was lovely to sit there and look across at the sea and the stars. Hope you find it as good as we did.

HotelInfo.Name: Beachcomber Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 7500 Coastal Highway, Ocean City, MD 21842
